page.title: 05SHELSLEY WALSH HILL CLIMB
page.content:
Lots of people watch the{Shelsley {hill climb}where old and new cars compete .The{Hill climb}has become an integral part of the{Shelsleys}- the local people either enjoy it, tolerate it or ignore it.The competitors still flock to each meeting in their amazing variety of machines and the supporters still faithfully patronise each event which surely has become an institution for three days every summer in the { {Teme Valley}. At the start there is a straight climb then there is a sharp bend followed by an 's' bend. Most of the crashes occur on the 's' bend. The final section is a straight climb to the finishing line.
{ Steven Bethell & Paul Brooks (age 10)
